Lonly has been live for x days and xx:xx:xx hours

You can use this variable in nightbot to get your uptime

You can customize the response using the following:

{channel}The channel's name

{days}Days the channel has been live

{hours}Hours the channel has been live (0-24)

{minutes}Minutes the channel has been live (0-60)

{seconds}Seconds the channel has been live (0-60)

{days(s, p)}Useful for dealing with singular/plural words. If the {days} variable is equal to 1 it will show whatever is in place of "s", otherwise it will show whatever is in place of "p". The same applies for {hours}, {minutes} and {seconds}.

Anything like <this> or [this] is called a block.

<{days} passed>This block will only be shown if the variable used inside is greater than 0.

[{hours} live]This block will always be shown.

Anything between 2 blocks will only be shown if there's a visible block before.

online{channel} has been live for <{days} day{days(s)}>, <{hours} hour{hours(s)}>, <{minutes} minute{minutes(s)}> and <{seconds} second{seconds(s)}>
offline{channel} is offline
